title: Achievement Diary/All achievements

properties.name: description
properties.value: This page contains a list of all Achievements found in RuneScape. For more details on a specific achievement, click the achievement's difficulty to be taken directly to its location in its respective diary.

content:
This page contains a list of all Achievements found in RuneScape. For more details on a specific achievement, click the achievement's difficulty to be taken directly to its location in its respective diary.

If any achievements or requirements are missing, please add them in or report them on the Talk page.

Special categories[edit | edit source]

Crossbow shortcuts[edit | edit source]

Several achievements require the use of one of the crossbow shortcuts placed throughout the world. Each shortcut has an Agility, a Ranged, and a Strength requirement in order to use it. In addition, players will need to wield any crossbow and a Mith grapple in order to cross the shortcut.

Note that there is a small chance that the grapple will break after using it to cross a shortcut; however, you will still receive credit for the achievement if your grapple breaks after use.

Chompy bird hunting[edit | edit source]

Each tier of the Western Provinces Diary requires players to hunt Chompy birds up to a certain kill count. In order to begin hunting these birds, players must complete the Big Chompy Bird Hunting quest, which requires 5 Fletching and 30 Ranged to complete. Higher Ranged levels will increase your accuracy and make hunting faster. Additionally, having 30 Fletching and starting Zogre Flesh Eaters is recommended, as this unlocks the faster-firing Comp ogre bow.

It is highly recommended to talk to the Elder Gnome child to claim your diary rewards as soon as you complete each difficulty, as each tier will significantly increase the chance of 2 Chompy birds appearing while hunting.

See the Chompy bird hat page for in-depth strategy on efficient Chompy bird hunting.

Diary Difficulty Task

Western Provinces Hard Claim a Chompy bird hat from Rantz after registering at least 300 kills
Western Provinces Elite Claim a Chompy bird hat from Rantz after registering at least 1000 kills

Pest Control[edit | edit source]

Several Western Provinces Diary achievements are associated with Pest Control. Most of these achievements are simply a Combat level check which allows them to be categorised by difficulty. Acquiring a set of Void Knight equipment for the Elite achievement, however, will require spending a significant amount of time in the minigame. Equipping this set also requires the following stats:

  • 42 Attack
  • 42 Strength
  • 42 Defence
  • 42 Hitpoints
  • 42 Magic
  • 42 Ranged
  • 22 Prayer

The official world for Pest Control is 344, where games usually take 23 minutes to complete. Note that in order to receive credit for "Completing a game", you do not need to win. You will need to win a game in order to receive points toward acquiring Void Knight equipment.

For more information about winning games consistently, see Pest Control/Strategies.

Combat level requirement Diary Difficulty Task

40 Western Provinces Easy Complete a novice game of Pest Control

40 Western Provinces Elite Equip any complete void set

Barbarian Assault[edit | edit source]

The Kandarin Diary has a few achievements related to playing Barbarian Assault. This minigame can quickly be reached by teleporting to the Barbarian Outpost with a Games necklace, or by using the minigame teleport.

New players to Barbarian Assault may be intimidated by the minigame's tutorial, which players are required to watch before participating in their first game. To get started, make sure you watch the display in the top-right corner of your screen and look for the mouth icon. Whenever this message changes, right-click your Penance horn and call out whatever it says. Then, look at the ear icon to see what you should be doing. For a summary of each role's jobs, see Basics - Player roles.

For more information on winning games effectively in every role, see Barbarian Assault/Strategies.

Slayer task assignments[edit | edit source]

Several achievements require receiving a task from one of the Slayer masters throughout RuneScape. Each Slayer master requires that the player have a certain Combat level before they can receive a task from them. Each achievement will trigger once the player accepts the assignment, so you do not need to complete the assignment that they give you - it can be blocked with Slayer points or dropped by talking to Turael in Burthorpe (though this will end your current Slayer task streak).

Fairy rings[edit | edit source]

Visiting an area by fairy ring is a commonly-seen achievement. In order to use fairy rings, you must start the quest Fairytale II - Cure a Queen. However, you do not need any of the skill requirements to complete the quest in order to access the fairy rings - you only need to complete Fairytale I - Growing Pains and reach the point in Part II where you first use a fairy ring. You will also need to have a Dramen staff or Lunar staff equipped anytime you wish to use the fairy rings.

Once you have unlocked fairy rings, all of these achievements can be completed very quickly.

categories== ===Crossbow shortcuts=== Several achievements require the use of one of the [[crossbow shortcuts]] placed throughout the world. Each shortcut has an [[Agility]], a [[Ranged]], and a [[Strength]] requirement in order to use it. In addition, players will need to wield any [[crossbow (weapon)|crossbow]] and a [[Mith grapple]] in order to cross the shortcut. Note that there is a small chance that the grapple will break after using it to cross a shortcut; however, you will still receive credit for the achievement if your grapple breaks after use. {| class="wikitable sortable lighttable" style="text-align:center; width:100%" !Agility Level !Ranged Level !Strength Level !Diary !Difficulty !Task |- |{{SCP|Agility|8}} |{{SCP|Ranged|37}} |{{SCP|Strength|19}} |[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary|Lumbridge & Draynor]] |[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Grapple across the [[River Lum]] |- |{{SCP|Agility|11}} |{{SCP|Ranged|19}} |{{SCP|Strength|37}} |[[Falador Diary|Falador]] |[[Falador Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Grapple up and then jump off the north [[Falador]] wall |- |{{SCP|Agility|36}} |{{SCP|Ranged|39}} |{{SCP|Strength|22}} |[[Kandarin Diary|Kandarin]] |[[Kandarin Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Use the grapple shortcut to get from the [[water obelisk]] to [[Catherby]] shore (one-way only) |- |{{SCP|Agility|39}} |{{SCP|Ranged|21}} |{{SCP|Strength|38}} |[[Ardougne Diary|Ardougne]] |[[Ardougne Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Grapple over [[Yanille]]'s south wall |- |{{SCP|Agility|53}} |{{SCP|Ranged|42}} |{{SCP|Strength|21}} |[[Karamja Diary|Karamja]] |[[Karamja Diary#Hard|Hard]] |Use the crossbow shortcut south of the [[Karamja Volcano|volcano]] |} {{Top}} ---- ===Chompy bird hunting=== Each tier of the [[Western Provinces Diary]] requires players to hunt [[Chompy bird]]s up to a certain kill count. In order to begin hunting these birds, players must complete the [[Big Chompy Bird Hunting]] quest, which requires {{SCP|Fletching|5|link=yes}} and {{SCP|Ranged|30|link=yes}} to complete. Higher Ranged levels will increase your accuracy and make hunting faster. Additionally, having {{SCP|Fletching|30|link=yes}} and starting [[Zogre Flesh Eaters]] is recommended, as this unlocks the faster-firing [[Comp ogre bow]]. It is highly recommended to talk to the [[Elder Gnome child]] to claim your diary rewards as soon as you complete each difficulty, as each tier will '''significantly increase the chance of 2 [[Chompy bird]]s appearing while hunting'''. See the [[Chompy bird hat]] page for in-depth strategy on efficient Chompy bird hunting. {|class="wikitable lighttable" style="text-align:center; width:100%" !Diary !Difficulty !Task |- |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Easy|Easy]] |Claim any [[Chompy bird hat]] from [[Rantz]] (30 kills min.) |- |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Claim a [[Chompy bird hat]] from [[Rantz]] after registering at least 125 kills |- |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Hard|Hard]] |Claim a [[Chompy bird hat]] from [[Rantz]] after registering at least 300 kills |- |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Elite|Elite]] |Claim a [[Chompy bird hat]] from [[Rantz]] after registering at least 1000 kills |} {{Top}} ---- ===Ultimate Ironman mode achievements=== [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Ultimate Ironman players are restricted from trading or otherwise receiving aid from other players. Some of the restrictions in place on these accounts would prevent them from being able to complete certain achievements. In these instances, alternate achievements of similar difficulty are available for players using these game modes. {|class="wikitable lighttable" style="text-align:center; width:100%" !Diary !Difficulty !Normal req(s) !Normal Task !Ironman req(s) !Ironman Task |- |[[Ardougne Diary|Ardougne]] |[[Ardougne Diary#Medium|Medium]] |[[The Hand in the Sand]] |Claim buckets of sand from [[Bert]] in [[Yanille]] |[[The Hand in the Sand]] |[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] (Ultimate only) Fill a bucket with sand using [[Bert]]'s sandpit |} {{Top}} ---- ===Pest Control=== Several [[Western Provinces Diary]] achievements are associated with [[Pest Control]]. Most of these achievements are simply a [[Combat level]] check which allows them to be categorised by difficulty. Acquiring a set of [[Void Knight equipment]] for the Elite achievement, however, will require spending a significant amount of time in the minigame. Equipping this set also requires the following stats: *{{SCP|Attack|42|link=yes}} *{{SCP|Strength|42|link=yes}} *{{SCP|Defence|42|link=yes}} *{{SCP|Hitpoints|42|link=yes}} *{{SCP|Magic|42|link=yes}} *{{SCP|Ranged|42|link=yes}} *{{SCP|Prayer|22|link=yes}} The official world for [[Pest Control]] is 344, where games usually take 23 minutes to complete. Note that in order to receive credit for "Completing a game", you do not need to win. You will need to win a game in order to receive points toward acquiring [[Void Knight equipment]]. For more information about winning games consistently, see [[Pest Control/Strategies]]. {| class="wikitable sortable lighttable" style="text-align:center; width:100%" !Combat level requirement !Diary !Difficulty !Task |- |{{SCP|Combat|40}} |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Easy|Easy]] |Teleport to [[Pest Control]] using the [[Minigame teleport]]s |- |{{SCP|Combat|40}} |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Easy|Easy]] |Complete a novice game of [[Pest Control]] |- |{{SCP|Combat|70}} |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Complete an intermediate game of [[Pest Control]] |- |{{SCP|Combat|100}} |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Hard|Hard]] |Complete a veteran game of [[Pest Control]] |- |{{SCP|Combat|40}} |[[Western Provinces Diary|Western Provinces]] |[[Western Provinces Diary#Elite|Elite]] |Equip any complete [[Void Knight equipment|void set]] |} {{Top}} ---- ===Barbarian Assault=== The [[Kandarin Diary]] has a few achievements related to playing [[Barbarian Assault]]. This minigame can quickly be reached by teleporting to the [[Barbarian Outpost]] with a [[Games necklace]], or by using the [[minigame teleport]]. New players to Barbarian Assault may be intimidated by the minigame's tutorial, which players are required to watch before participating in their first game. To get started, make sure you watch the display in the top-right corner of your screen and look for the mouth icon. Whenever this message changes, right-click your Penance horn and call out whatever it says. Then, look at the ear icon to see what you should be doing. For a summary of each role's jobs, see [[Barbarian Assault/Basics#Player roles|Basics - Player roles]]. For more information on winning games effectively in every role, see [[Barbarian Assault/Strategies]]. {|class="wikitable lighttable" style="text-align:center; width:100%" !Diary !Difficulty !Task !Details |- |[[Kandarin Diary|Kandarin]] |[[Kandarin Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Complete a wave of [[Barbarian Assault]] |Achievement triggers as soon as you enter a game. |- |[[Kandarin Diary|Kandarin]] |[[Kandarin Diary#Hard|Hard]] |Purchase and equip a [[Granite body]] from [[Barbarian Assault]] |Requires defeating the [[Penance Queen]] at least once. {{Coins|95000}} to buy the [[Granite body]] (no points spent) {{SCP|Strength|50}} and {{SCP|Defence|50}} to equip the [[Granite body]] |- |[[Kandarin Diary|Kandarin]] |[[Kandarin Diary#Elite|Elite]] |Read the blackboard at [[Barbarian Assault]] after reaching Level 5 in every role | |} {{Top}} ---- ===Slayer task assignments=== Several achievements require receiving a task from one of the [[Slayer master]]s throughout ''RuneScape''. Each Slayer master requires that the player have a certain [[Combat level]] before they can receive a task from them. Each achievement will trigger once the player accepts the assignment, so you do not need to complete the assignment that they give you - it can be blocked with [[Slayer points]] or dropped by talking to [[Turael]] in [[Burthorpe]] (though this will end your current Slayer task streak). {| class="wikitable sortable lighttable" style="text-align:center; width:100%" !Combat level requirement !Quests required !Diary !Difficulty !Task |- |{{SCP|Combat|20}} |[[Priest in Peril]] |[[Morytania Diary|Morytania]] |[[Morytania Diary#Easy|Easy]] |Get a [[Slayer task]] from [[Mazchna]] |- |{{SCP|Combat|40}} | |[[Varrock Diary|Varrock]] |[[Varrock Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Get a [[Slayer task]] from [[Vannaka]] |- |{{SCP|Combat|70}} |[[Lost City]] |[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary|Lumbridge & Draynor]] |[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Get a [[Slayer task]] from [[Chaeldar]] |- |{{SCP|Combat|100}} {{SCP|Slayer|50}} |[[Shilo Village]] |[[Karamja Diary|Karamja]] |[[Karamja Diary#Hard|Hard]] |Be assigned a [[Slayer task]] by [[Duradel]] in [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]] |} {{Top}} ---- ===Fairy rings=== Visiting an area by [[fairy ring]] is a commonly-seen achievement. In order to use fairy rings, you must start the quest [[Fairytale II - Cure a Queen]]. However, you '''do not need any of the skill requirements''' to complete the quest in order to access the fairy rings - you only need to complete [[Fairytale I - Growing Pains]] and reach the point in Part II where you first use a fairy ring. You will also need to have a [[Dramen staff]] or [[Lunar staff]] equipped anytime you wish to use the fairy rings. Once you have unlocked fairy rings, all of these achievements can be completed very quickly. {|class="wikitable lighttable" style="text-align:center; width:100%" !Fairy ring code !Diary !Difficulty !Task |- |{{Fairycode|BIS}} |[[Ardougne Diary|Ardougne]] |[[Ardougne Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Enter the Unicorn pen in [[Ardougne Zoo]] using fairy rings |- |{{Fairycode|AIR}} |[[Ardougne Diary|Ardougne]] |[[Ardougne Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Visit the island east of the [[Necromancer Tower]] |- |{{Fairycode|CIP}} |[[Fremennik Diary|Fremennik]] |[[Fremennik Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Travel to [[Miscellania]] by fairy ring |- |{{Fairycode|ALS}} |[[Kandarin Diary|Kandarin]] |[[Kandarin Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Travel to [[McGrubor's Wood]] by fairy ring |- |{{Fairycode|CIR}} |[[Kourend & Kebos Diary|Kourend & Kebos]] |[[Kourend & Kebos Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Travel to the [[fairy ring]] south of [[Mount Karuulm]] |- |{{Fairycode|DIS}} |[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary|Lumbridge & Draynor]] |[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary#Medium|Medium]] |Travel to the [[Wizards' Tower]] by fairy ring |} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 5 January 2022 |update = Nex: The Fifth General |change = "Kill each of the God Wars Dungeon Generals" was changed to "Kill the generals of Armadyl, Bandos, Saradomin and Zamorak in the God Wars Dungeon." }} {{Subject changes |date = 26 March 2015 |update = System Update (26 March 2015) |change = Changed the sand delivery [[Ardougne Medium]] task for [[Ultimate Ironmen]] to "Fill a [[bucket of sand|bucket with sand]] using [[Bert]]'s [[sand pit]].
